cursor.desc: Parameter for pagination. File comments are paginated for a single file. Set `cursor` equal to the `next_cursor` attribute returned by the previous request's `response_metadata`. This parameter is optional, but pagination is mandatory: the default value simply fetches the first "page" of the collection of comments. See [pagination](/apis/web-api/pagination) for more details.

file.desc: Specify a file by providing its ID.

limit.desc: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the list hasn't been reached.

examples:
{
    "ok": true,
    "file": {
        "id": "F0S43PZDF",

errors.access_denied: Unable to access the file (slack connect)
errors.file_deleted: The requested file has been deleted
errors.channel_canvas_deleted: The requested file is a channel canvas that has been deleted
errors.canvas_globally_disabled: Canvas is disabled for this team
errors.canvas_disabled_user_team: Canvas is disabled on user's team for connected Channels
errors.canvas_disabled_file_team: Canvas is disabled on file's team
errors.not_visible: Do not have permission to view the file
errors.template_not_visible: Do not have permissions to view this template
errors.slack_connect_canvas_sharing_blocked: Admin has disabled sharing of Canvas links in all Slack Connect communications
